title: Ticket #3301: Improve gridmanager reaction to gahp failing to start
description:
Whenever a GAHP server exits unexpectedly, the gridmanager exits as well. This makes recovery in the gridmanager easier and works well enough if a GAHP failure is a rare event. With BOSCO, we start GAHPs on remote machines over SSH. Now, GAHP failures can be very common, caused by things such as network failure, remote machine failure, invalid ssh credentials, and incorrect platform for the remote binaries. The gridmanager's suicide reaction can now be overkill.

An easy improvement is to have the gridmanager not suicide if the GAHP fails to start up properly. Instead, the gridmanager can put the affected jobs on hold with a meaningful hold reason.
